labels.analysis: The MCP Server is primarily focused on deploying and managing applications on Google Cloud Run. It facilitates seamless integration between AI agents/systems and cloud infrastructure by providing tools for project creation, service deployment, and resource management. The server enables deployment of both local files/folders and in-context file content, with secure IAM authentication for cloud resource management. The core use case is cloud-based application deployment and management through AI-driven workflows.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Cloud Services" was chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around deploying and managing services on Google Cloud Run - a key aspect of cloud infrastructure management. Secondary "Development Tools" is included because it supports application deployment workflows which are central to development processes. Secondary "API Integration" is relevant due to the server's role as an intermediary between AI agents and cloud services. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories sufficiently cover the functionality.

tools.name: create_project
tools.description: Creates a new GCP project and attempts to attach it to the first available billing account. A project ID can be optionally specified; otherwise it will be automatically generated.

projectId.description: Optional. The desired ID for the new GCP project. If not provided, an ID will be auto-generated.

tools.name: list_services
tools.description: Lists Cloud Run services in a given project and region.

region.description: Region where the services are located

tools.name: get_service
tools.description: Gets details for a specific Cloud Run service.

project.description: Google Cloud project ID containing the service

region.description: Region where the service is located

service.description: Name of the Cloud Run service

tools.name: deploy_local_files
tools.description: Deploy local files to Cloud Run. Takes an array of absolute file paths from the local filesystem that will be deployed. Use this tool if the files exists on the user local filesystem.

project.description: Google Cloud project ID. Do not select it yourself, make sure the user provides or confirms the project ID.

region.description: Region to deploy the service to

service.description: Name of the Cloud Run service to deploy to

files.description: Array of absolute file paths to deploy (e.g. ["/home/user/project/src/index.js", "/home/user/project/package.json"])

tools.name: deploy_local_folder
tools.description: Deploy a local folder to Cloud Run. Takes an absolute folder path from the local filesystem that will be deployed. Use this tool if the entire folder content needs to be deployed.

project.description: Google Cloud project ID. Do not select it yourself, make sure the user provides or confirms the project ID.

region.description: Region to deploy the service to

service.description: Name of the Cloud Run service to deploy to

folderPath.description: Absolute path to the folder to deploy (e.g. "/home/user/project/src")

tools.name: deploy_file_contents
tools.description: Deploy files to Cloud Run by providing their contents directly. Takes an array of file objects containing filename and content. Use this tool if the files only exist in the current chat context.

project.description: Google Cloud project ID. Leave unset for the app to be deployed in a new project. If provided, make sure the user confirms the project ID they want to deploy to.

region.description: Region to deploy the service to

service.description: Name of the Cloud Run service to deploy to

filename.description: Name and path of the file (e.g. "src/index.js" or "data/config.json")

files.description: Array of file objects containing filename and content

server_info_crawled.name: Cloud Run Deployment Server
server_info_crawled.author: @GoogleCloudPlatform/cloud-run-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable AI agents to deploy applications and manage services on Google Cloud Run seamlessly. List, create, and deploy projects and services directly from AI-powered IDEs or assistant apps. Securely connect to remote Cloud Run instances with IAM authentication for safe cloud resource management.

tools.name: create_project
tools.description: Creates a new GCP project and attempts to attach it to the first available billing account. A project ID can be optionally specified; otherwise it will be automatically generated.

projectId.description: Optional. The desired ID for the new GCP project. If not provided, an ID will be auto-generated.

tools.description: Lists Cloud Run services in a given project and region.

project.description: Google Cloud project ID. Do not select it yourself, make sure the user provides or confirms the project ID.

region.description: Region to deploy the service to

service.description: Name of the Cloud Run service to deploy to

tools.description: Deploy files to Cloud Run by providing their contents directly. Takes an array of file objects containing filename and content. Use this tool if the files only exist in the current chat context.

project.description: Google Cloud project ID. Leave unset for the app to be deployed in a new project. If provided, make sure the user confirms the project ID they want to deploy to.

region.description: Region to deploy the service to

service.description: Name of the Cloud Run service to deploy to

filename.description: Name and path of the file (e.g. "src/index.js" or "data/config.json")

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@GoogleCloudPlatform/cloud-run-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
